    Gijs Wijnholds

    PhD student at Queen Mary University of London

    • London, UK
    • Email
    • Github
    • Google Scholar

    CV

    Education

    • PhD in Compositional Distributional Semantics, Queen Mary University of London, 2016-present
    • MSc. in Logic. Institute for Logic, Language and Computation, University of Amsterdam, 2011-2014 (cum laude)
    • BSc. in Artificial Intelligence. Utrecht University, 2009-2011 (cum laude)
    • BSc. in Liberal Arts & Sciences. Utrecht University, 2008-2010 (unfinished)

    Publications

    • A Proof-Theoretic Approach to Scope Ambiguity in Compositional Vector Space Models

      Wijnholds, G. (2018). "A Proof-Theoretic Approach to Scope Ambiguity in Compositional Vector Space Models." To appear in JLM.

    • Classical Copying versus Quantum Entanglement in Natural Language: The Case of VP-ellipsis

      Wijnholds, G. and Sadrzadeh, M. (2018). "Classical Copying versus Quantum Entanglement in Natural Language: The Case of VP-ellipsis." CAPNS 2018 proceedings.

    • Lexical and Derivational Meaning in Vector-Based Models of Relativisation

      Moortgat, M. and Wijnholds, G. (2017). "Lexical and Derivational Meaning in Vector-Based Models of Relativisation." Proceedings of the 21st Amsterdam Colloquium.

    • Coherent Diagrammatic Reasoning in Compositional Distributional Semantics

      Wijnholds, G. J. (2017). "Coherent Diagrammatic Reasoning in Compositional Distributional Semantics." WoLLIC 2017, Lecture Notes in Computer Science. 10388.

    • Vector Semantics for Lambek Calculus with Contraction

      Wijnholds, G, and Sadrzadeh, M. "Vector Semantics for Lambek Calculus with Contraction." Workshop on Logic and Algorithms in Computational Linguistics 2017 (LACompLing2017). 2017.

    • Syntactic control for compositional vector space models

      Moortgat, M. J., and Wijnholds, G. "Syntactic control for compositional vector space models." Topology, Algebra, and Categories in Logic 2015 (2015): 204-206.

    • Conversions between D and MCFG: Logical Characterizations of the Mildly Context-Sensitive Languages

      Wijnholds, G. J. (2014). "Conversions between D and MCFG: Logical Characterizations of the Mildly Context-Sensitive Languages." Computational Linguistics in the Netherlands Journal. 4.

    • Categorical Foundations for Extended Compositional Distributional Models of Meaning

      Wijnholds, G. (2014). "Categorical Foundations for Extended Compositional Distributional Models of Meaning." MSc Thesis, Institute for Logic, Language, and Computation.

    • Investigations into categorial grammar: Symmetric pregroup grammar and displacement calculus

      Wijnholds, G. (2011). "Investigations into categorial grammar: Symmetric pregroup grammar and displacement calculus." BSc Thesis, Utrecht University.
